it
Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--it.Graphable
        |
        +--it.Graph
public class Graph
extends Graphable

This class allows a graph based on a set of points to be graphed.

protected  void evaluateXY(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p)
          As this is the most generic and special instance of a graphable object with the points to be plotted held in a container, this evaluation method is somewhat redundant as no longer is the function f(x) being evaluated for a particular x - rather 2d points are plotted and the work done in the overrided drawGraph method.

public Graph()
Creates an empty PointGraph with default point marker as being a NoPoint.

Graph

public Graph(double[][] p)
Creates a new PointGraph object and sets the points contained within to the values in the double array and with default point marker as being a cross.
Parameters:
p - double precision array of points to be the graph

evaluateXY

protected void evaluateXY(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p)
As this is the most generic and special instance of a graphable object with the points to be plotted held in a container, this evaluation method is somewhat redundant as no longer is the function f(x) being evaluated for a particular x - rather 2d points are plotted and the work done in the overrided drawGraph method.

drawGraph

public void drawGraph(java.awt.Graphics g,
                      GraphPanel owner)

This method is overriding the superclass method. It is done this way as a point graph requires some special handling of how the graphs are drawn - mainly because the plot values are held in a container and need to be integrated through instead of working along the x axis and getting an exact value for f(x).

Overrides:
drawGraph in class Graphable
Parameters:
g - the graphics context
owner - the graph panel that this graph is being drawn to
